source_sentence: 修行本起經卷下
translation: Xiuxing benqi jing, vol. 2

source_sentence: 後漢西域三藏竺大力共康孟詳譯
translation: Latter Han Dynasty Translated in detail by the Tripiṭaka of the Western Regions, Zhu Daishi and Kang Meng

source_sentence: 遊觀品第三
translation: The Third Part of the Chapter on Traveling to Contemplation

source_sentence: 「於是王告太子：『當行遊觀。』
translation: The king then told the prince, 'Should you go on a excursion to observe it?'

source_sentence: 太子念言：『久在深宮，思欲出遊，審得所願。』
translation: The prince thought, 'I've been in the deep palace for a long time, thinking about going out and traveling, and I'll examine what I want.'

source_sentence: 王勅國中，太子當出，嚴整道巷，灑掃燒香，懸繒幡蓋，務令鮮潔。
translation: The king had ordered that the princes of the country should go out and arrange the road lanes in an orderly way. They swept up the dirt and burned incense, hanging silk banners and canopies to make them pure and clean.

source_sentence: 太子導從，千乘萬騎，始出東城門，時首陀會天，名難提和羅，欲令太子速疾出家，
translation: The prince, accompanied by a thousand chariots and ten thousand horsemen, began to leave the eastern gate of the city. Then Sudarśana (known as Nandipāla) wished to allow the prince to quickly renounce household life.

source_sentence: 救濟十方三毒火然，願雨法水，以滅毒火。
translation: They rescue the three poisonous fires in the ten directions, wishing to rain down the Dharma water to extinguish the poisonous fires.

source_sentence: 難提和羅，化作老人，踞於道傍，頭白齒落，皮緩面皺，肉消脊軁，支節萎曲，
translation: Nandipāla transformed himself into an old man. He was seated at the side of the road, with white hair on his head and white teeth protruding from his forehead. His skin was loose and his face wrinkled; his flesh disappeared, and his back became crooked.

source_sentence: 眼淚鼻涕，涎出相屬，上氣肩息，身色黧黑，頭手肬掉，軀體戰懾，惡露自出，
translation: Their eyes, tears, nose, and nose weep; their saliva all flowed out in unison. Their upper air blew away at the shoulders with a sigh of exhalation. Their bodies looked coarse and dark but their hair stood on end as if they were trembling. Their bodies trembled and shivered violently.

source_sentence: 坐臥其上。
translation: He sat and lay on top of it.

source_sentence: 太子問言：『此為何人？』
translation: The prince asked, 'What's this person?'

source_sentence: 天神寤僕，僕言：『老人。』
translation: The gods, goddesses, and servants said, 'Elderly man.'

source_sentence: 『何等為老？』
translation: 'What's old?'

source_sentence: 曰：『夫老者，年耆根熟，形變色衰，氣微力竭，食不消化，骨節欲離，
translation: He said, “When an old man grows old, his faculties mature and his body shape changes; his vitality weakens, his food is not digested, and his bones are dismembered.

source_sentence: 坐起須人，目冥耳聾，便旋即忘，言輙悲哀，餘命無幾，故謂之老。』
translation: When someone asks for a seat to rise up, their eyes are blind and their ears are deaf, so they quickly turn around and forget it. They say sorrowfully, pitying that there won't be many other lives, which is why they're called old.'

source_sentence: 太子歎曰：『人生於世，有此老患，愚人貪愛，何可樂者？
translation: The prince lamented, saying, 'I'll be born in the world with this old age and affliction, and foolish people will crave it; how can they enjoy it?'

source_sentence: 物生於春，秋冬悴枯，老至如電，身安足恃。』
translation: When things are born in spring, they'll be emaciated in autumn and wither, grow old like lightning, and have stable bodies and feet to rely on.'

source_sentence: 「『老則色衰，　　病無光澤，
translation: 'With old age, form declines, and illness has no luster.

source_sentence: 皮緩肌縮，　　死命近促。
translation: Their skin is loose and their flesh shrinks, and they're approaching death and life.

source_sentence: 老則形變，　　喻如故車，
translation: The transformation of old age is likened to an old chariot.

source_sentence: 法能除苦，　　宜以力學。
translation: The Dharma can remove suffering, so it's appropriate to train with strength.

source_sentence: 命欲日夜盡，　　及時可勤力，
translation: When your life is about to end day and night, you can work diligently at the right time.

source_sentence: 世間諦非常，　　莫惑墮冥中。
translation: The worldly truth is impermanent, so don't be confused and fall into the darkness.

source_sentence: 當學燃意燈，　　自練求智慧，
translation: You should train in the burning of the lamp of mind, Practice yourself and seek wisdom.

source_sentence: 離垢勿染污，　　執燭觀道地。』
translation: Be free of dirt and undefiled, hold a candle and contemplate the ground of the path.'

source_sentence: 即說偈言：「於是太子，即迴車還，愍傷一切，有此太患，憂思不樂。
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, So the prince immediately returned back in his chariot, grieving that all of them had this great misfortune and were sad and unhappy.

source_sentence: 王問其僕：『太子出遊，何故速還？』
translation: The king asked his servant, 'Why did the prince leave and return so quickly?'

source_sentence: 其僕答言：『道逢老人，傷念不樂。』
translation: The servant replied, 'I'm sad and unhappy when I meet an old man on the road.'

source_sentence: 還宮愁思，數年小差，復欲出遊。
translation: He returned to the palace in sorrow and thought of it for several years. There was a minor mishap and he again wished to go on an excursion.

source_sentence: 王勅國中，太子當出，禁諸臭穢，莫在道側。
translation: The king ordered that the princes of the country should go out, forbidding all smelly and filthy people from being at the side of the road.

source_sentence: 於是太子，駕乘出城南門。
translation: The prince then rode out of the south gate of the city in his carriage.

source_sentence: 天化為病人，在于道側，身瘦腹大，軀體黃熟，咳嗽嘔[口*逆]，百節痛毒，
translation: The gods transformed him into a sick man, lying at the side of the road. His body was thin and large in stature, his abdomen grew yellowish; he coughed and vomited [mouthing], and all his limbs were painful and venomous.

source_sentence: 九孔敗漏，不淨自沒，目不見色，耳不聞聲，呻吟呼吸，手足摸空，喚呼父母，
translation: Their eyes do not see any visible matter, and their ears cannot hear sound. They groan and breathe, touching the air with their hands and feet; they call to their parents.

source_sentence: 悲戀妻子。
translation: He was grieved for his wife and children.

source_sentence: 太子問曰：『此為何等？』
translation: The prince asked, 'What's this?'

source_sentence: 其僕答言：『病人也。』
translation: The servant replied, 'He's sick.'

source_sentence: 『何如為病？』
translation: 'What's thus for sickness?'

source_sentence: 答言：『人有四大，地、水、火、風，大有百一病，展轉相鑽，四百四病，
translation: Answer: People have four major elements: earth, water, fire and wind. There are one hundred and one minor ailments in every major element of the earth:

source_sentence: 同時俱作，此人必以極寒、極熱、極飢、極飽、極飲、極渴，將節失所，
translation: If they do so at the same time, this person is bound to experience extreme cold, heat, hunger, thirst, nutriment, drinking, and thirst, losing all his limbs.

source_sentence: 臥起無常，故致斯病。』
translation: Because lying and rising are impermanent, they cause this illness.'

source_sentence: 太子嘆曰：『吾處富貴，極世所珍，飲食快口，放心自恣，婬於五欲，
translation: The prince exclaimed, “I live in a wealthy and prosperous place with the highest worldly value. My food and drink are delicious and my mouth is full of energy. I am at ease to satisfy myself and indulge in the pleasures of the five senses.

source_sentence: 不能自覺，亦當有病，與彼何異。』
translation: If you can't perceive it for yourself, you'll also have illness, so why is it different from that?'

source_sentence: 「『是身為脆哉，　　常俱四大中，
translation: 'Is this body so fragile that it's always present in the four elements?

source_sentence: 九孔不淨漏，　　有老有病患。
translation: The nine pores are impure and contaminated, with old age and illness.

source_sentence: 生天皆無常，　　人間老病憂，
translation: All births and heavens are impermanent. Old age, sickness, and sorrow in the human world:

source_sentence: 觀身如雨泡，　　世間何可樂。』」
translation: Observing the body like a rain bubble, how can the world be happy?'

source_sentence: 即說偈言：「於是太子，迴車還宮，思念一切有此大患。
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, So the prince returned to the palace in his chariot and thought that everything was suffering from this great danger.

source_sentence: 王問其僕：『太子出遊，今者何如？』
translation: The king asked his servant, 'The prince went out on a journey, but what's the present?'

source_sentence: 其僕答言：『逢見病人，於是不樂。』
translation: The servant replied, 'When I met a sick man, I didn't enjoy it.'

source_sentence: 數年小差，復欲出遊。
translation: After a few years of minor differences, he again wished to go on an excursion.

source_sentence: 王勅國中，太子當出，平治臭處，無令近道。
translation: The king ordered that the princes of the country should go out to quell the foulsmelling place and not allow them to approach the road.

source_sentence: 出西城門，天作死人，扶輿出城，室家隨車，啼哭呼天，奈何捨我，永為別離。
translation: When he came out at the west gate of the city, a deity appeared as a dead man. Carrying his carriage out of the city with him, their families followed the chariot and cried in distress, “Dear god, why would you abandon me?

source_sentence: 太子問曰：『此為何等？』
translation: The prince asked, 'What's this?'

source_sentence: 僕言：『死人。』
translation: The servant said, 'Dead man.'

source_sentence: 『何如為死？』
translation: 'What's like death?'

source_sentence: 答言：『死者盡也，精神去矣。
translation: He replied, 'Death is over, and the spirits are gone.'

source_sentence: 四大欲散，魂神不安，風去息絕，火滅身冷，風先火次，魂靈去矣。
translation: When the four elements were about to disperse, his spirits became restless. As the wind went away, the fire died and his body became cold. The wind preceded the fire but his spirits departed after each other.

source_sentence: 身體挺直，無所復知，旬日之間，肉壞血流，膖脹爛臭，無一可取。
translation: In ten days the flesh disintegrates and blood flows out, screaming and foulsmelling. There is not a single thing to eat.

source_sentence: 身中有蟲，蟲還食之，筋脉爛盡，骨節解散，髑髏異處，脊脇肩臂，髀脛足指，
translation: There was an insect in his body, and the insects returned to eat it. His tendons and veins were all burned out, and his bones dissociated themselves from each other. The skeleton was found elsewhere, with back, flanks, shoulders, arms, legs, hips, shins, feet, and fingers.

source_sentence: 各自異處，飛鳥走獸，競來食之。
translation: They each went to a different place, where flying birds and animals rushed to eat them.

source_sentence: 天龍鬼神，帝王人民，貧富貴賤，無免此患。』
translation: The gods, dragons, ghosts, emperors, and people, rich and poor, noble and humble, can't escape this danger.'

source_sentence: 「『觀見老病死，　　太子心長歎，
translation: ' Observing old age, illness, and death, the prince deeply sighs in admiration.

source_sentence: 人生無常在，　　吾身亦當然。
translation: Man’s birth is impermanent, and so is my body.

source_sentence: 是身為死物，　　精神無形法，
translation: This body is a dead thing, but the spirit has no form.

source_sentence: 假令死復生，　　罪福不敗亡。
translation: Even if someone were to die and return to life, sins and fortune wouldn't perish.

source_sentence: 終始非一世，　　從癡愛久長，
translation: The beginning and end are not the same as one time period: it is from delusion that craving lasts.

source_sentence: 自此受苦樂，　　身死神不喪。
translation: From then on, they'll experience pain and pleasure, and their bodies won't die or lose their spirits.

source_sentence: 非空非海中，　　非入山石間，
translation: They are neither empty nor in the ocean, Nor do they enter mountains or stones.

source_sentence: 無有地方所，　　脫止不受死。』
translation: There's no place, and there's no place where they'll be liberated and not subject to death.'

source_sentence: 太子長嘆，而說頌曰：「於是太子，迴車還宮，愍念眾生有老、病、死苦惱大患，
translation: The prince, exclaiming for a long time, uttered these verses: Then the prince returned to his chariot and returned to the palace. With pity for sentient beings who are suffering from old age, sickness, and death, he spoke these verses:

source_sentence: 憂思不食。
translation: He's sad and doesn't eat.

source_sentence: 王問其僕：『太子出遊，寧有樂乎？』
translation: The king asked his servant, 'Is the prince going out to travel, or is there any pleasure?'

source_sentence: 即答王言：『逢見死人，遂致不樂。』
translation: He then answered the king, 'When I met a dead man, I ended up unhappy.'

source_sentence: 數年小差，復欲遊觀，嚴駕出北城門。
translation: Several years later, after a minor departure, he again wished to visit the monastery and came out of the northern city gates in an orderly carriage.

source_sentence: 天復化作沙門，法服持鉢，行步安詳，目不離前。
translation: Again, the god transformed himself into an ascetic, dressed in the Dharma robe and with his almsbowl in hand, he walked step by step in a peaceful manner, not letting his eyes go before him.

source_sentence: 太子問曰：『此為何人？』
translation: The prince asked, 'What's this person?'

source_sentence: 其僕答曰：『沙門也！』
translation: The servant answered, 'That's an ascetic!'

source_sentence: 『何等為沙門？』
translation: 'What's an ascetic?'

source_sentence: 『蓋聞沙門之為道也，捨家妻子，捐棄愛欲，斷絕六情，守戒無為，得一心者，
translation: 'I've heard that the ascetic is a practitioner of the path who abandons his family and wife, abandons craving, stops the six emotions, observes precepts without doing anything, and attains one-pointedness of mind.

source_sentence: 則萬邪滅矣。
translation: Then all evils will cease.

source_sentence: 一心之道，謂之羅漢，羅漢者真人也。
translation: The path of one mind is called the arhat, and the arhat is a real person.

source_sentence: 聲色不能污，榮位不能屈，難動如地，已免憂苦，存亡自在。』
translation: Sound and form can't be defiled, prosperity and position can't be flexed, and it's as difficult to move as the ground, so they're free of sorrow and suffering and have control over birth and death.'

source_sentence: 太子曰：『善哉！
translation: The prince said, 'Good!

source_sentence: 唯是為快。』
translation: This is the only thing that's pleasant.'

source_sentence: 「『痛哉有此苦，　　生老病死患，
translation: 'It's painful that there's this suffering of birth, old age, illness, and death.

source_sentence: 精神還入罪，　　經歷諸勤苦。
translation: Their spirits return to sin and undergo various kinds of hardship.

source_sentence: 今當滅諸苦，　　生老病死除，
translation: I will now extinguish the suffering of birth, old age, sickness, and death.

source_sentence: 不復與愛會，　　永令得滅度。』
translation: They won't be able to associate with their loved ones again, and they'll be permanently liberated.'

source_sentence: 即說偈言：「於是太子，即迴車還，齋思不食。
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, So the prince returned in his chariot and fasted without eating.

source_sentence: 王問其僕：『太子又出，意豈樂乎？』
translation: The king asked his servant, 'Is the prince happy when he comes out again?'

source_sentence: 僕言：『行見沙門，倍更憂思，不向飲食。』
translation: The servant said, 'When I saw the ascetic, I became even more grieved and didn't go to eat or drink.'

source_sentence: 王聞大怒，舉手自擊，前勅修道，復令太子輙見不祥，罪應刑戮。
translation: The king was furious when he heard this, raised his hand and struck him himself. He had previously instructed the prince to cultivate Buddhism but again caused the prince to see that it was inauspicious and would be punished by death.

source_sentence: 即召群臣，各使建議，設何方術，當令太子不出學道。
translation: He then summoned the ministers, each of whom was instructed to advise him on where to set up his skillful means so that the prince wouldn't leave home to study the path.

source_sentence: 有一臣言：『宜令太子監農種殖，役其意思，使不念道。』
translation: A minister said, 'Should the prince be instructed to supervise farming and growing crops so that he doesn't think of the path?'

source_sentence: 便以農器犁牛千具，僕從大小相率上田，令監課之。
translation: He then took a thousand implements for farming, plows, cattle, and oxen, went up to the field with their attendants, large and small, and ordered them to supervise him.

source_sentence: 太子坐閻浮樹下，見耕者墾壤出蟲，天復化令牛領興壞，蟲下淋落，烏隨啄吞。
translation: When the prince was sitting under a Jambudvīpa tree, he saw a plower clearing soil and producing worms, and gods again transformed the cow to lead it up and down. The worms went down and drowned, and the cow pecked and swallowed along with them.

source_sentence: 又作蝦蟇，追食曲蟺，蛇從穴出，吞食蝦蟇，孔雀飛下啄吞其蛇，有鷹飛來，
translation: Again, they become frogs and chase after the crocodiles. A snake emerges from its burrow to feed on the frogs; a peacock flies down to peck at them and swallows them.

source_sentence: 搏取孔雀，鵰鷲復來，搏撮食之。
translation: He wrestled the peacock and eagles came back to feed on it.

source_sentence: 菩薩見此眾生品類展轉相吞，慈心愍傷，即於樹下得第一禪。
translation: Seeing these sentient beings, the bodhisattva gradually swallowed each other in various ways, and with kindness and pity, he attained the first dhyāna under a tree.

source_sentence: 日光赫奕，樹為曲枝，隨蔭其軀。
translation: The sun was shining brilliantly, and the trees were crooked branches that shaded their bodies.

source_sentence: 「王念太子，常在宮中，未曾執苦，即問其僕：『太子何如？』
translation: The king thought that the prince was always in the palace and hadn't experienced suffering, so he asked his servants, 'What's the prince like?'

source_sentence: 對言：『今在閻浮樹下，一心禪定。』
translation: He replied, 'Now, I'm at the foot of a Jambudvīpa tree, concentrating my mind in meditation.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『吾令監作欲亂其思，然故禪定，在家何異？』
translation: The king said, 'I ordered the superintendent to disturb his thoughts, but why is it different at home from my old meditation?'

source_sentence: 王勅嚴駕便往迎之。
translation: The king ordered an official carriage to go and greet him.

source_sentence: 遙見太子，樹枝曲蔭，神曜非常。
translation: From a distance he saw the prince, whose shadow was covered by branches of trees and divine light shining brilliantly.

source_sentence: 不識下馬，為作禮時，即與俱還。
translation: He didn't know how to dismount the horse, and when he paid homage for it, he returned with them.

source_sentence: 未及城門，無數千人，華香奉迎，相師一切，稱壽無量。
translation: He did not reach the city gates but was greeted by countless thousands of people with flowers and incense. All his attendants lived an immeasurable number of years.

source_sentence: 王問：『何故？』
translation: The king asked, 'Why is that?'

source_sentence: 梵志答言：『明旦日出，七寶當至。』
translation: The priest answered, 'The sun will rise tomorrow morning, and the seven treasures will arrive.'

source_sentence: 王大歡喜，必成聖王。
translation: The king was greatly delighted, thinking that he would surely become a sage king.

source_sentence: 出家品第五
translation: The Fifth Chapter of Becoming a renunciant

source_sentence: 「是時太子，還宮思惟，念道清淨，不宜在家，當處山林，研精行禪。
translation: The prince then returned to the palace and reflected, remembering that the path was pure and he shouldn't stay at home; he should be in a mountain forest where he studied meditation.

source_sentence: 至年十九，四月七日，誓欲出家。
translation: On the seventh day of the fourth month, when he was nineteen years old, he vowed to leave home.

source_sentence: 至夜半後，明星出時，諸天側塞虛空，勸太子去。
translation: At midnight, when the stars emerged, the heavenly gods at their sides filled the sky and exhorted the prince to depart.

source_sentence: 時裘夷見五夢，即便驚覺，太子問之：『何故驚寤？』
translation: When Kauśina saw five dreams, he was even startled and awoke, and the prince asked him, Why are you so startled?

source_sentence: 對曰：『向者夢中，見須彌山崩、月明落地、珠光忽滅、頭髻墮地、人奪我蓋，
translation: He said in reply, “In a dream I saw that the polar mountain collapsed, the moonlight fell to the ground at dawn, the light of the jewel suddenly disappeared, my hair dropped into the ground on top of my head, and people snatched off my lid.

source_sentence: 是故驚覺。』
translation: That's why I'm frightened.'

source_sentence: 菩薩心念：『五夢者應吾身耳，念當出家。』
translation: The bodhisattva thought to himself, 'The five dreams should be my ears, thinking that I'll leave home.'

source_sentence: 告裘夷言：『須彌不崩、月明續照、珠光不滅、頭髻不落、傘蓋今在，
translation: He said to Kauṇḍinya, “The polar mountain will not crumble. The moonlight will continue to shine brightly as long as the moon; the light of the jewels will not be extinguished. The topknot of the Buddha’s head will not fall down.

source_sentence: 且自安寐，莫憂失蓋。』
translation: Just lie down and don't worry about losing your cover.'

source_sentence: 於是諸天言：『太子當去，恐作稽留。』
translation: The gods then said, 'The prince will depart, and I'm afraid he'll stay.'

source_sentence: 召烏蘇慢(漢名厭神)，適來入宮，國內厭寐。
translation: He summoned Wu Suzhi (known as the disillusioned spirit in Chinese), who came to the palace and fell asleep because of his disillusionment.

source_sentence: 時難提和羅，化諸宮殿盡為塚墓，裘夷伎女皆成死人，骨節解散，髑髏異處，
translation: Nandipāla then transformed all the palaces into tomb mounds. The cowherds and nymphs all became dead bodies, their bones dissolved and disintegrated, and the skeletons were buried in a different place.

source_sentence: 膖脹爛臭，青瘀膿血，流漫相屬。
translation: Swollen, swollen, rotten, and foul-smelling abscesses, bruises, pus, and blood all flow together.

At the end of his good deeds, he will fall into the three evil destinies and be reborn in the six forms of an animal.

source_sentence: 欲脫致難。
translation: They want to be freed and cause difficulties.

source_sentence: 汝輩亂人道意，不計非常，經歷劫數，展轉五道。
translation: You people disturb the minds of the Way and do not think it is impermanent. For many kalpas you have passed through the five realms of rebirth.

source_sentence: 今汝曹等，未離勤苦。
translation: Now, you people haven't yet parted with the pain and suffering of diligence.

source_sentence: 吾在世間，處處所生，觀視老者如母，中者如姊，小者如妹，諸姊等各各還宮，
translation: I am in the world. Wherever I may be born, I look upon old people as if they are my mothers, those in the middle [world] as if they were my sisters, and those younger [world] as if they were my sisters. Each of them returns to her own palace.

source_sentence: 勿復作是曹事。』
translation: Don't do such a thing again.'

source_sentence: 菩薩一言，便成老母，頭白齒落，眼冥脊傴，柱杖相扶而還。
translation: As soon as the Bodhisattva had uttered these words he became an old woman, with white hair on her head and white teeth protruding out of her mouth. Her eyes were blindfolded by darkness; she was cuddled up in a crooked posture, supported by both pillars and canes.

source_sentence: 「魔見三女還皆成老母，益大忿怒，更召鬼神王，合得十八億，皆從天來下，
translation: “When Māra saw that the three daughters had all returned to become old mothers, he became even more furious and summoned the king of ghosts and spirits. Altogether they obtained one hundred and eighty million [hermaphrodites], all descending from heaven.

source_sentence: 圍繞菩薩，三十六由旬，皆使變成師子、熊羆、兕虎、象、龍、牛、馬、犬、豕、猴猿之形，
translation: They surrounded the bodhisattvas, thirty-six yojanas in circumference, and caused them all to take the forms of lions, bears, tigers, elephants, dragons, dragons, cows, horses, dogs, mules, and monkeys.

source_sentence: 不可稱言。
translation: It can't be called that.

source_sentence: 蟲頭人軀蚖虵之身黿龜之首，而有六目，或一頸而多頭，齒牙爪距，擔山吐火，
translation: The heads of these animals are like the heads of a tortoise or a turtle, with six eyes. Some have one neck but many heads; their teeth, teeth, tusks, and nails are separated from each other. They carry mountains and spit out fire.

source_sentence: 雷電四繞，擭持戟鉾。
translation: Thunder and lightning surrounded them in all directions, and the enemy was carrying a halberd and spear.

source_sentence: 菩薩慈心，不驚不怖一毛不動，光顏益好，鬼兵不能得近。
translation: The bodhisattva's compassionate mind isn't frightened or terrified by a hair that doesn't move, and his radiant appearance grows more beautiful, so ghosts and armies can't get close to him.

source_sentence: 「『比丘何求坐樹下，　　樂於林藪毒獸間，
translation: 'Why would a monk seek to sit under a tree and enjoy the pleasures of a forest or among poisonous animals?

source_sentence: 雲起可畏窈冥冥，　　天魔圍繞不以驚。』
translation: Fearsome clouds arise in the darkness, and gods and Māra don't frighten them.'

source_sentence: 「『古有真道佛所行，　　恬惔為上除不祥，
translation: 'In the past, there were buddhas of true enlightenment who practiced quietude as the best way to remove inauspiciousness.

source_sentence: 其成最勝法滿藏，　　吾求斯座決魔王。』
translation: They've accomplished the most excellent teaching that completes the store, and I'm seeking this seat to resolve the demon king of Māra.'

source_sentence: 「『汝當作王轉金輪，　　七寶自至典四方，
translation: 'You will be the king who turns the golden wheel, and you will have seven treasures at your command in the four directions.

source_sentence: 所受五欲最無比，　　斯處無道起入宮。』
translation: The five desires that are received are most incomparable, and there's no path here to enter the palace.'

source_sentence: 「『吾覩欲盛吞火銅，　　棄國如唾無所貪，
translation: 'My lustful desire is to swallow the copper of a fire, and I abandon my country like a spittle without craving it.

source_sentence: 得王亦有老死憂，　　去此無利勿妄談。』
translation: The king who obtains it also has the grief of old age and death, so don't talk falsely about it.'

source_sentence: 「『何安坐林如大語，　　委國財位守空閑，
translation: 'Why is it that you're sitting in a forest like the great saying, entrusting your national wealth and position to keep an open space?

source_sentence: 不見我興四部兵，　　象馬步兵十八億？』
translation: Don't you see me raising four armies of elephants, horses, and foot soldiers of  1.8 billion?'

source_sentence: 「『已見猴猿師子面，　　虎兕毒虵豕鬼形，
translation: 'I've seen the face of a monkey, a lion, a tiger, a viper, and a poisonous ghost.

source_sentence: 皆持刀劍擭戈鉾，　　超躍哮吼滿空中。
translation: They all carry swords, swords, arrows, spears, and spears, leaping and roaring in the sky.

source_sentence: 設復億姟神武備，　　為魔如汝來會此，
translation: Even if there are billions of myriadstical weapons, Come and assemble here for the sake of Māra like you.

source_sentence: 矢刃火攻如風雨，　　不先得佛終不起。
translation: An arrow and a blade of fire attack like wind and rain, without first attaining the Buddha, it never rises up.

source_sentence: 魔有本願令我退，　　吾亦自誓不空還，
translation: The devil has the original vow to cause me to retreat, And I also vow not to return in vain.

source_sentence: 今汝福地何如佛？　　於是可知誰得勝。』
translation: How could your blessed ground now be like that of a buddha?’ So you may know who will be victorious.

source_sentence: 「『吾曾終身快布施，　　故典六天為魔王，
translation: 'I once spent my whole life quickly giving alms, and the six heavenly kings of old were Māra King.

source_sentence: 比丘知我宿福行，　　自稱無量誰為證？』
translation: A monk knows the merits of my past actions, and who will realize them if he calls himself immeasurable?'

source_sentence: 「『昔吾行願從錠光，　　受拜為佛釋迦文，
translation: 'In the past, I practiced and vowed to follow Dīpaṅkara, accepting homage as the Buddha and Śākyamuni,

source_sentence: 怒畏想盡故坐斯，　　意定必解壞汝軍。
translation: Because you're sitting here because your thoughts of anger and fear have ended, your mind will surely be liberated and destroyed by your army.

source_sentence: 我所奉事諸佛多，　　財寶衣食常施人，
translation: I serve many buddhas, Always giving wealth, jewels, food, and clothing to those who need them.

source_sentence: 仁戒積德厚於地，　　是以脫想無患難。』
translation: The virtue of the accumulation of kindness and morality is thicker than the earth, so it's because there's no difficulty in freeing yourself from conception.'

source_sentence: 「菩薩即以智慧力，　　申手按地是知我，
translation: The bodhisattva then, by the power of wisdom, extended his hand and pressed it to the ground to know that this was me.

source_sentence: 應時普地軯大動，　　魔與官屬顛倒墮。
translation: At the time, the whole earth shook with great trembling, and Māra and his officials fell down in error.

source_sentence: 魔王敗績悵失利，　　惛迷却踞前畫地，
translation: The king of Māra was defeated and disheartened, withdrew to sit on the painted ground in front of him.

source_sentence: 其子又曉心乃寤，　　即時自歸前悔過：
translation: The boy again awakened, and his mind was disturbed. He immediately returned to where he had been and repented:

source_sentence: 「『吾以不復用兵器，　　等行慈心却魔怨，
translation: 'By not using weapons again, I'll equally practice compassion and rid Māra of his enemies.

source_sentence: 世用兵器動人心，　　而我以汝等眾生。
translation: The world uses weapons to move the minds of sentient beings, And I give them to you sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若調象馬雖已調，　　然後故態會復生，
translation: If they tame elephants and horses, even if they have tamed them, Then the old form will arise again.

source_sentence: 若得最調如佛性，　　已如佛調無不仁。』
translation: If he attains the supreme discipline like the buddha-nature, then there's nothing unworthy of being disciplined like the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 「垓天見佛擒魔眾，　　忍調無想怨自降，
translation: Hundreds of thousands of myriadstical celestial beings saw the Buddha capture the hosts of Māra, enduring and subduing their enemies without ideation.

source_sentence: 諸天歡喜奉華臻：　　『非法王壞法王勝。
translation: The gods rejoiced and offered flowers to him, saying, 'The illegitimate king who destroys the king of the Dharma is superior.

source_sentence: 本從等意智慧力，　　慧能即時禳不祥，
translation: Based on the power of wisdom based on equal intent, Wisdom can instantly destroy bad omens.

source_sentence: 能使怨家為弟子，　　當禮四等道之證。
translation: Those who can cause their enemies to become disciples should venerate the realization of the four equal paths.

source_sentence: 面如滿月色從容，　　名聞十方德如山，
translation: His countenance is like the full moon, his color follows his features; Fame and reputation in the ten directions are like mountains of virtue.

source_sentence: 求佛像貌難得比，　　當稽首斯度世仙。』
translation: Seeking the Buddha's appearance is difficult to compare, so you should bow your head in homage to save the worldly sage.'

source_sentence: 魔王便前說偈問言——菩薩慈心，所問盡答——曰：「菩薩累劫清淨之行，
translation: The king of Māra then went on to ask a question in verse, saying-the bodhisattva's compassionate mind answered all the questions he asked-saying, A bodhisattva who practices purely for eons like this will not be able to attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 至儒大慈，道定自然，忍力降魔，鬼兵退散，定意如故，不以智慮，無憂喜想，
translation: With great compassion and great benevolence, he was naturally concentrated on the path of enlightenment; his patience subdued Māra. The spirits and armies withdrew in dispersal but his concentration remained as before. He did not think thoughts of sorrow or joy without thinking of it as wisdom.

source_sentence: 是日夜半後，得三術闍(三術闍者漢言三神滿具足)，漏盡結解，自知本昔久所習行，
translation: At midnight on that day, he attained the three skillful means of ācārya (Sanskrit: “complete with the three supernormal powers”). Knowing his past practice for a long time, he renounced the defilements and entered nirvana.

source_sentence: 四神足念，精進定、欲定、意定、戒定，得變化法，所欲如意，不復用思；
translation: The fourth is the supernormal power of mental command, which consists of concentrated effort, concentrated desire, concentrated thought, and concentrated absorption. Having attained this power of magical transformation, he does as he wishes without further thought.

source_sentence: 身能飛行；
translation: Their bodies can fly.

source_sentence: 能分一身，作百作千至億萬無數，復合為一；
translation: They can be divided into one body, made into a hundred forms and counted from a thousand to a hundred million.

source_sentence: 能徹入地，石壁皆過，從一方現，俯沒仰出，譬如水波；
translation: They can penetrate into the ground and pass through all the stone walls. Appearing from one side, they sink down and emerge upward like waves of water.

source_sentence: 能身中出水火；
translation: They are able to produce water and fire from their bodies.

source_sentence: 能履水行虛，身不陷墜；
translation: They can walk on water and travel in space, yet their bodies do not fall.

source_sentence: 坐臥空中，如飛鳥翔；
translation: Sitting or lying in the air, he is like a flying bird.

source_sentence: 立能及天，手捫日月，欲身平立，至梵自在；
translation: The gods of the realm of desire stand upright, reaching as far as Brahmā’s freedom.

source_sentence: 眼徹視，耳洞聽，意預知，諸天人龍鬼神蚑行蠕動之類，身行口言心所念，
translation: Their eyes looked in all directions, and their ears heard what they saw. They foresaw the thoughts of gods, humans, nāgas, ghosts, yakṣas, and wrigglers, as well as bodily, verbal, and mental actions.

source_sentence: 悉見聞知。
translation: They all see, hear, and know.

source_sentence: 諸有貪婬無貪婬者，有瞋怒無瞋怒者，有愚癡無愚癡者，有愛欲無愛欲者，
translation: Those with craving and those without craving, those with anger and those without anger, those with folly and those without folly, and those with desire and those without desire.

source_sentence: 有大志行無大志行者，有內外行無內外行者，有念善不念善者，有一心無一心者，
translation: Those who practice with great determination but do not practice with great determination, those who practice both inside and without and those who practice neither inside nor outside, those who are mindful of what’s good but not mindful of what’s good, and those with one mind but not those without one mind.

source_sentence: 有解脫意無解脫意者，一切悉知。
translation: He knows all those who have the intention to be liberated and those who don't have the intention to be liberated.

source_sentence: 「菩薩觀天上、人中、地獄、畜生、鬼神五道，先世父母、兄弟、妻子中外姓字，
translation: “Enlightening beings observe the heavens, humans, hells, animals, and ghosts in the five realms of rebirth:

source_sentence: 一一分別，一世十世，百千億万無數世事，至于天地一劫崩壞空荒之時，
translation: In each of these divisions, there are one world and ten worlds, hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of incalculable worldly affairs, up to the time when heaven and earth crumbled into emptiness in an eon.

source_sentence: 一劫始成，人物初興，能知十劫百劫至千萬億無數劫中，內外姓字，衣食苦樂，
translation: In the course of ten kalpas, from a hundred kalpas up to thousands of myriads of koṭis of incalculable kalpas, they can know the names of the gods and goddesses, their internal and external bodies, as well as the painful and pleasurable conditions of food and drink.

source_sentence: 壽命長短，死此生彼，展轉所趣，從上頭始，諸所更身，生長老終，形色好醜，
translation: Their life spans are long and short; they die here and are born there. They go from one place to another in succession, beginning at the top of their heads.

source_sentence: 賢愚苦樂，一切三界，皆分別知。
translation: Good and bad, painful and pleasant, all three realms, are discriminated and known.

source_sentence: 見人魂神，各自隨行，生五道中，或墮地獄，或墮畜生，或作鬼神，或生天上，
translation: They see human spirits and goddesses, each following their lead, born in the five destinies, sometimes falling into hell, sometimes into animals, sometimes into ghosthood, sometimes being reborn in heaven.

source_sentence: 或入人形，有生豪貴富樂家者，有生卑鄙貧賤家者。
translation: Some may enter the human form, and some will be born in a house of noble wealth and happiness, and some will be born in a house of lowliness and poverty.

source_sentence: 知眾生或五陰自弊，一色像，二痛痒，三思想，四行作，五魂識，皆習五欲，
translation: They know whether sentient beings may have five aggregates that are naturally bad, which are one form or formless, two pain and itch, three thoughts, four volitions, and five souls and consciousnesses, all conditioned by the five desires.

source_sentence: 眼貪色，耳貪聲，鼻貪香，舌貪味，身貪細滑，牽於愛欲，或於財色思望安樂，
translation: The eye desires form, the ear desires sound, the nose desires smell, the tongue desires taste, and the body desires fineness and smoothness, which lead to craving or contemplation of wealth and form for peace and happiness.

source_sentence: 從是生諸惡本，從惡致苦。
translation: From this, bad roots arise, and from bad causes suffering.

source_sentence: 能斷愛習，不隨婬心，大如毛髮，受行八道，則眾苦滅，譬如無薪亦無火，
translation: He can cut off the habit of craving and not follow coarse thoughts, which are as large as hair. If he receives and practices the eight paths, all forms of suffering will be extinguished, just as there is no fuel and no fire.

source_sentence: 是謂無為度世之道。
translation: This is called the worldly path of liberation through nonexistence.

source_sentence: 「菩薩自知，已棄惡本，無婬怒癡，生死五陰諸種悉斷，無餘災孽所作已成，
translation: “The enlightening beings know for themselves that they have abandoned the root of evil, are free from lust, anger, and delusion. The seeds of the five aggregates of birth and death have all been annihilated, and there is no remaining destructive action to be done.

source_sentence: 智慧已了。
translation: His wisdom has been comprehended.

source_sentence: 明星出時，廓然大悟，得無上正真道，為最正覺，得佛十八法，有十神力、四無所畏。
translation: When the star emerges, he's clearly greatly enlightened, attains the unsurpassed true path, becomes the most correct awakening, and attains the 18 Buddha-dharmas, which have ten supernormal powers and four fearlessnesses.

source_sentence: 佛十八法者，謂從得佛至于泥曰，一、無失道，二、無空言，三、無妄志，
translation: The Buddha’s eighteen doctrines are as follows:

source_sentence: 四、無不淨意，五、無若干想，六、無不省視，七、志欲無減，八、精進無減，
translation: 4. the absence of impure thoughts, 5. the absence of certain perceptions, 6. the absence of uncontaminated attention, 7. the absence of decrease in aspiration, and 8. the absence of decrease in effort,

source_sentence: 九、定意無減，十、智慧無減，十一、解脫無減，十二、度知見無減，
translation: (9) The state of concentration is not diminished; (10) the state of wisdom is not diminished; (11) the state of liberation is not diminished; (12) the state of surpassing knowledge and vision is not diminished.

source_sentence: 十三、古世之事悉知見，十四、來世之事悉知見，十五、今世之事悉知見，
translation: 13. He knows and sees all the events of ancient times, 14. He knows and sees all the events of future lives, and 15. He knows and sees all the events of the present life.

source_sentence: 十六、攬眾身行化以始所知，十七、攬眾言行化以始所知，十八、攬眾意行化以始所知，
translation: The sixteenth is to embrace the practices and transformations of all bodies as the beginning of knowing, the seventeenth is to embrace the practices and transformations of all words as the beginning of knowing, and the eighteenth is to embrace the practices and transformations of all minds as the beginning of knowing.

source_sentence: 是為佛十八不共之法。
translation: These are the eighteen unique qualities of a buddha.

source_sentence: 「十神力者，諸佛悉見知，深微隱遠，是處非處，明審如有，一力也；
translation: “The ten kinds of supernormal power are: the buddhas all see and know, deeply and subtly, whether it is right or wrong. They clearly discern if it exists or not; this is one power.

source_sentence: 佛悉明知來今往古所造行地，其受報處，二力也；
translation: The Buddha clearly knows the places of past, present, and future created practices as well as the places where they receive retribution: these are the two powers.

source_sentence: 佛悉分別天人眾生彼彼異念，三力也；
translation: The Buddha discerns all the different thoughts of gods, humans, sentient beings, and other beings—three powers.

source_sentence: 佛知眾生若干種語及度世語，四力也；
translation: The Buddha knows the various kinds of speech of sentient beings, as well as the speech for salvation. These are the four powers.

source_sentence: 佛悉了知世間雜種無量情態，五力也；
translation: The Buddha knows the world in all its various forms and infinite states of mind: these are the five powers.

source_sentence: 佛能現禪解定行，除眾勞諍，六力也；
translation: The Buddha is able to manifest the practice of meditation, understanding, and meditative absorption. This is apart from all weariness and torpor by the six powers.

source_sentence: 佛知欲縛知欲解要在所宜行，七力也；
translation: The Buddha, knowing the bond of desire and knowing the liberation from it, dwells in appropriate action: this is the seventh power.

source_sentence: 佛智如海善言無量追識一切宿命所更，八力也；
translation: The Buddha’s knowledge is like an ocean of good words, immeasurable; it knows the past lives of all sentient beings and goes wherever they are.

source_sentence: 佛天眼淨見人物死神所出生，善惡殃福，隨行受報，九力也；
translation: The Buddha’s divine eye sees all beings with purity, and they are born in the realm of death. Good or evil, bad or good fortune, receive retribution according to their actions: these are the nine powers.

source_sentence: 佛漏已盡，無復縛著，神真叡智，自知見證，究暢道行，可作能作，無餘生死，
translation: The Buddha has extinguished the taints of defilement and is no longer attached to it. His supernormal powers are genuine, his knowledge and wisdom are self-knowing and experiencing; he perfects the practice of enlightenment, knows what can be done and what cannot be done, leaving birth and death without remainder.

source_sentence: 其智明審，是為佛十神力也。
translation: Their knowledge and insight are the Buddha’s ten supernatural powers.

source_sentence: 「四無所畏者，佛神智正覺，無所不知，愚人或言：『佛未悉知。』
translation: The four fearlessnesses are when the Buddha's supernormal knowledge and right awakening know nothing, and foolish people sometimes say, 'The Buddha doesn't know everything.'

source_sentence: 至於梵摩眾聖，皆莫能論佛之智故，獨步不懼，一無畏也。
translation: As for the Brahmas and other sages, none of them could discuss the Buddha's wisdom, so they were alone and didn't fear it, which is the first fearlessness.

source_sentence: 佛漏盡悉止，愚惑相言：『佛漏未盡。』
translation: When the Buddha's contaminants are ended, they all stop, and the characteristic of delusion says, 'The Buddha's contaminants haven't ended yet.'

source_sentence: 至梵摩眾聖，莫能論佛之志故，獨步不懼，二無畏也。
translation: Up to the Brahmakāyika sages, they can't discuss the Buddha's aspirations, so they don't fear it when they walk alone, which are two kinds of fearlessness.

source_sentence: 佛說經戒，天下誦習，愚惑相言：『佛經可遏。』
translation: The Buddha teaches the sūtras and precepts, which are recited throughout the world, and foolish people say, 'The Buddha's sūtras can be suppressed.'

source_sentence: 至梵摩眾聖，莫能論毀佛正經故，獨步不懼，三無畏也。
translation: Up to the Brahma sages, they can't discuss disparaging the Buddha's right sūtras because they don't fearlessly walk alone and don't fear them, which are the three fearlessnesses.

source_sentence: 佛現道義，言真而要，能度苦厄，愚惑相言：『不能度苦。』
translation: The Buddha shows the meaning of the path, saying that it's true and essential to save them from suffering and distress, and foolish people say, 'I can't save them from suffering.'

source_sentence: 至梵摩眾聖，莫能論佛正道故，周行不懼，四無畏也。
translation: Up to the Brahmakāyika sages, they can't discuss the Buddha's right path, so they travel around without fear, which are the four fearlessnesses.

source_sentence: 「佛得是意，一切知見，坐自念言：『是實微妙，難知難明，甚難得也，
translation: Having gained this thought, the Buddha knew and saw everything. Sitting there, he thought to himself, “This is indeed subtle, difficult to know and difficult to fathom.

source_sentence: 高而無上，廣不可極，淵而無下，深不可測，大苞天地，細入無間，養育眾生，
